result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron E Boyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 3:44pm. 
Defendant Myron E Boyle in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Boyle to:
--serve five months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber release privileges only for treatment; to commence forthwith 

On Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Boyle to:
--serve five months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber release privileges only for treatment ; to commence forthwith, concurrent with Count #1

Days credit for time already served given:  62 days 

The Court indicates that if Mr. Boyle gets his assessment done, he may request Huber release for employment. 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid court financial oblications. 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the restitution amount  [the amount originally ordered was $1330.90, joint and several, payable to DMK, c/o Jenny Biefang.]
recess 4:04pm.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case #16CF49 and #16CF259 called at 10:54am. 
Defendant Myron E Boyle in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin, however then ADA Hall substitutes for her and DA Happ exits at 11:25am. 
DA Susan Happ verifies victim rights compliance; a victim restitution form is submitted.
recess 11:02; reconvene 11:08am
The Defense files a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form.  Mr. Boyle waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing in each case. The Court accepts these waivers and binds Mr. Boyle over. 
Service of the Informations in both cases admitted; readings waived. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Case #16CF49-Counts #1 & #2, and in Case #16CF259-Counts #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Boyle guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining counts.  Further the Court reads in an uncharged referral (DA Case #2016JE1277) for Possession of Drug Paraphernalia on the date of violation of March 19, 2016, and thereafter further prosecution of this referral is barred.

On both cases, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Boyle on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or therapy as ordered by the Agent 
--payment of all costs, fees and assessement. 
--In case #16CF49 only: to pay restitution, joint and several, of $1330.90, payable to DMK, c/o Jenny Biefang
--In case #16CF259 only: to pay restitution, joint and several, of $1,764.39 payable to Earl Nichols and Mary Nichols 

Based on Mr. Boyle reporting that he has already submitted a DNA sample, the Court does not order DNA sample provision in these cases. 
Days credit for time already served:  0 days credit in Case #16CF49;  and 53 days credit in Case #16CF259.
The Court orders expungement as to both cases, indicating to Mr. Boyle that he will need to pursue petitioning the Court for this when his Probation terms are completed. 
Felony firearm prohibition warnings are given. 
Voting prohibition is imposed. 
recess 11:44am.
and Inspection; Defendant's

Case called at 3:38pm [mo]
Defendant Myron E Boyle in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court continues previously set signature bond. 
The Court orders Mr. Boyle to go through the booking process if he has not already done so. 
recess: 3:43pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on  6/22/16 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 8/16/16 at 10:30am

The Petition is GRANTED because the court finds the person is currently indigentl An attorney shall be appointed at county expense as set forth below. The person shall be required to reimburse the county for such representation as follows - Repayment at the rate of $100 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 6-10-2016. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court
Attorney David Zarwell
with State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible form attached

Case called at 4:20pm [mo]
Defendant Myron E Boyle in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Mr. Boyle indicates that he wishes to have counsel

The Court requires a $1000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with D.M.K., N.O.N. or K.M.Q.
--no presence at the residence of D.M.K.
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
